description: From French biopsie, from Ancient Greek βίος (bíos, “life”) + ὤψ (ṓps, “eye”).

entries.meaning: The removal and examination of a sample of tissue, cells, or bodily fluid from a living body for diagnostic purposes.
examples: We will need to perform a biopsy to determine whether the tumour is malignant or benign.

verbs.description: biopsy (third-person singular simple present biopsies, present participle biopsying, simple past and past participle biopsied)

entries.meaning: To take a sample (a biopsy) for pathological examination.
examples: They biopsied the lump but it turned out to be non-cancerous.
